summary:
• Spain has recalled its ambassador from Argentina due to a dispute over comments made by Argentine politician José María Milei.
• The recall was prompted by Milei's remarks, which sparked diplomatic tensions between the two nations.
• The move aims to resolve the issue and restore bilateral relations between Spain and Argentina.

• Heavy rainfall causes widespread flooding in Brazil.
• Rescue helicopters are deployed to assist affected areas.
• Emergency services work to reach stranded residents and provide aid.

• French President Emmanuel Macron is set to visit New Caledonia amid ongoing riots.
• The unrest stems from tensions between indigenous Kanaks and French settlers over independence and land rights.

• A German prince is on trial for allegedly planning a coup.
• The trial has sparked intense media interest in Germany.
• The motive behind the alleged coup remains unclear.

• A Greek court has thrown out a trial involving nine men accused in connection with a deadly shipwreck.
• The verdict means the charges will be dropped against all nine defendants.
• The ruling is seen as a major setback for families of the victims who were seeking justice.

• Haiti is a Caribbean island nation with a rich cultural heritage.
• The country has faced significant challenges, including political instability and natural disasters.
• Haitians have made efforts to rebuild their nation and improve living conditions despite these obstacles.

• A charity event features a unique obstacle course with buns as obstacles
• Participants must climb a tower covered in 40-foot-long Chinese buns
• The event aims to raise funds for those in need

• India's diverse regions feature distinct campaign styles reflecting local cultures.
• Regional parties adapt their messages to resonate with voters.
• National parties face challenges in reaching rural areas due to language barriers.

• Thousands attended the funeral procession for Iran's late president.
• Iranians had mixed reactions to the president's sudden passing due to his helicopter crash.
• The helicopter crash, which occurred while flying a US-designed aircraft, was attributed to technical failure, leading to the appointment of an acting president.

• Detainees in an Israeli hospital were found shackled and blindfolded.
• Seven Palestinians were killed in an Israeli West Bank raid.
• Israel shut down the Associated Press' Gaza live feed.

• Over 150 earthquakes hit the Naples region
• No reports of human casualties or significant damage yet
• Local authorities monitoring the situation closely

• Kenya defends cost of jet for President Ruto's US trip.
• As U.S. influence in Africa wanes, Kenya bucks the trend.

• Hundreds of Mozambican patients have died due to a nationwide medical workers' strike
• The strike has resulted in severe shortages of medicines and essential healthcare services
• The government has urged the striking health workers to resume their duties immediately

• A passenger was injured and had to be carried off the plane after experiencing severe turbulence.
• The incident resulted in one fatality and left 30 others injured among the 230 passengers onboard.
• The cause of the turbulence is under investigation by authorities.

• A blue fireball lit up the skies over Spain.
• The cause of the phenomenon is currently unknown.
• Experts will investigate to determine its origin.

• Thousands flee due to Russian military escalation in Ukraine's Kharkiv region.
• Russia launches intense attacks on civilian areas, causing widespread destruction and displacement.
• Ukrainian authorities work to provide aid and support to affected populations amidst escalating conflict.

1. A 73-year-old British man died during a turbulent flight where passengers experienced extreme turbulence.
2. The UK High Court ruled that Julian Assange can appeal against his US extradition order.
3. No other major events occurred in the UK related to these news stories.

• Donald Trump's defense team has rested its case in a hush-money trial.
• Rudy Giuliani was back in court regarding the 2020 presidential election.
• Thousands of people in Texas lost electricity during a heatwave.
• The International Criminal Court seeks arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders.
• Joe Biden criticized an "outrageous" request for an international arrest warrant for Israeli leaders.
